title: Service C to F Network Timeout Causing Intermittent Failures

symptoms.user_facing: 50% of C path requests timing out, intermittent pattern
monitoring_alerts: Network packet loss between C and F subnets

root_cause.primary: Network switch firmware bug causing packet drops between C and F network segments
root_cause.secondary: Inadequate connection retry logic in C's F client configuration

analysis_steps: 1. Intermittent 50% failure rate on A->C->F path
2. Service C shows SocketTimeoutException to F
3. Service F logs show some requests never arriving
4. Network monitoring reveals 15% packet loss C<->F
5. Other services communicating fine, isolated to C-F link
6. Network team identifies faulty switch firmware
7. Switch replaced, confirmed network stability restored
resolution: Replaced network switch, updated C service retry configuration
lessons_learned: Network monitoring should track inter-service packet loss
Cross-team communication protocols for infrastructure issues
